intro: Lepidium tolmaczovii, commonly known as the Tolmaczov's cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and alternate along the stem. Lepidium tolmaczovii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
